definition: to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to help/to assist/mutual assistance/to rush into or up/to raise or hold up/high/tall/old variant of 欀/chariot horse (old)/change (old)
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: Liu hoped the MPs may visit the Expo to celebrate the event together.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎各位议员到世博会参观，共襄盛举。

sentences.english: We welcome the people of China and the world to join us.
sentences.chinese: 我们欢迎中国人民和全世界人民与我们共襄盛举。

sentences.english: We sincerely hope you will be with us.
sentences.chinese: 我们真诚地希望各位能够共襄盛举。

sentences.english: I am very happy to be part of it.
sentences.chinese: 我非常欢喜能够共襄盛举。

sentences.english: He said he did it to encourage others to give.
sentences.chinese: 他说他所做是为鼓励其他人也能共襄盛举。

definition: to get together all at once
to discuss matters of vital importance
to be present at a meeting
to invite a group of people (to assemble for a gathering)
to congregate in one hall (idiom); to gather under one roof
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
to gather happily under one roof
